patterns: Tell me about KMIT
What is KMIT?
Give me some information about KMIT
About KMIT
Can you provide details about KMIT?
What does KMIT stand for?
Brief me about KMIT
I'd like to know more about KMIT
KMIT
responses: Established in 2007, KMIT is affiliated to Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad and is approved by AICTE. KMIT believes in a learner-centric environment and modernizes its resources and teaching processes to align with the latest technological trends.

KMIT, founded in 2007, is affiliated to Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad and approved by AICTE. We focus on encouraging learner autonomy with continuous efforts to modernize resources and teaching methodologies.

Since 2007, KMIT has been affiliated with Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad and approved by AICTE. We emphasize creating a learner-centric environment and constantly upgrade our resources and teaching methods.

patterns: What is the vision of KMIT?
Tell me the vision of KMIT
KMIT vision
What does KMIT aspire to achieve?
Can you share KMIT's vision?
What's the future vision of KMIT?
responses: KMIT's vision is to be the fountainhead in producing highly skilled, globally competent engineers and making India a world leader in software products and services.
Our vision at KMIT is to produce quality graduates trained in the latest software technologies and related tools, striving to make India a leader in software products and services.
The vision of KMIT is to become a leading institution in producing skilled, globally competent engineers and to make India a leader in the software industry.

patterns: What is the mission of KMIT?
Tell me the mission of KMIT
KMIT mission
What are the goals of KMIT?
Can you explain KMIT's mission?
What's the mission statement of KMIT?
responses: KMIT's mission is to provide a learning environment that fosters problem-solving skills, professional ethics, and lifelong learning through various platforms, preparing students to become successful professionals.
Our mission at KMIT is to establish industry interactions to prepare students for the industry, promote research-based projects, and encourage students to create new enterprises.

The mission of KMIT is to support students and faculty in accelerating their learning and professional growth, while also promoting nationalism and developing effective solutions to India's challenges.

patterns: Tell me about KMIT's equity policy

Equity policy of KMIT
Can you explain KMIT's equity policy?
What is the policy for equity at KMIT?
responses: KMIT is committed to achieving global excellence in teaching, research, consulting, and placements by providing a conducive environment in the fields of computer sciences and information technology.
Our equity policy focuses on maintaining global standards in teaching, research, and placements, ensuring continuous advancement in computer sciences and IT.
At KMIT, we are dedicated to creating a professional and global outlook in teaching and research, striving for excellence in all our endeavors.

patterns: achievements
Tell me about KMIT's achievements
What are the achievements of KMIT?
KMIT achievements
Can you list some achievements of KMIT?
What has KMIT accomplished?
Share some achievements of KMIT
responses: KMIT has achieved numerous accolades, including ranking among the top 100 local chapters by NPTEL in 2021 and winning 1st Prize in the Smart India Hackathon in 2018.
Our achievements include being awarded INR 50 Lakhs for a research project by BIRAC in 2020, and ranking 91 globally in the IEEEXTREME Competition in 2019.
KMIT has been recognized for its innovation and growth, including 4.5 stars by the Institution Innovation Council in 2020 and multiple awards by Cambridge English Language Assessment.

patterns: Tell me about KMIT's achievements in 2021
What were KMIT's achievements in 2020?
KMIT achievements in 2019
List KMIT's achievements for 2018
What did KMIT achieve in 2017?
Share KMIT's achievements yearwise
Can you tell me KMIT's achievements in 2016?
What are the accomplishments of KMIT in 2015?
Achievements of KMIT in 2013
What did KMIT achieve in 2010?
responses: In 2021, KMIT was ranked among the top 100 local chapters by NPTEL.
In 2020, KMIT was awarded INR 50 Lakhs for the Clinical Translational Research CAD project by BIRAC, Dept. of Biotechnology, Govt. of India, and received 4.5 stars by Institution Innovation Council.
In 2019, KMIT was ranked 91 globally in the IEEEXTREME Competition.
In 2018 and 2019, KMIT ranked 1 in NPTEL and won 1st Prize in Smart India Hackathon in 2018.
In 2017, KMIT won the award for Best Academic Support at the Best 25 Higher Education Preparation Centre Awards for South Asia organised by Cambridge English Language Assessment.
In 2016, KMIT won the award for Innovation & Growth at the Cambridge English Annual Coordinators Meet.

In 2015, KMIT was a finalist at the Cambridge English Language Assessment awards for preparation centres in the category of Digital Innovation & Technology. We were the only college in Asia to make it.
In 2013, KMIT bagged 2nd position all over India in the Microsoft Imagine Cup.
From 2018 to the present, KMIT has had 64 GSoC projects.
In 2010, KMIT ranked first in IBM's The Great Mind Challenge, a national competition.

KMIT courses

responses: KMIT offers various B.Tech programs accredited by AICTE and affiliated to JNTUH, Hyderabad. These include Computer Science & Engineering (CSE), Computer Science & Engineering (Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning) (CSM), Computer Science & Engineering (Data Science) (CSD), and Information Technology (INF).

patterns: What are the eligibility criteria for B.Tech admission at KMIT?
Can you tell me about the eligibility criteria for B.Tech admission?
Eligibility criteria for B.Tech at KMIT
What qualifications are required for B.Tech admission at KMIT?
responses: To be eligible for admission to the B.Tech program at KMIT, candidates must have passed the Intermediate (10+2) examination conducted by the board of Intermediate education, Govt. of Telangana State, or any other examination recognized as equivalent, with Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry as optional subjects.

Eligibility for B.Tech admission at KMIT requires candidates to have completed their Intermediate (10+2) with Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry as optional subjects, or any equivalent qualification recognized by the board of Intermediate education, Govt. of Telangana State.

Candidates seeking admission to the B.Tech program at KMIT should have passed the Intermediate (10+2) examination or its equivalent with Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry as optional subjects. This is the basic eligibility criteria for B.Tech admission.

patterns: How are admissions conducted for the B.Tech program at KMIT?
Tell me about the admission process for B.Tech at KMIT
Admission process for B.Tech at KMIT
What is the admission pattern for B.Tech admission at KMIT?
responses: Admissions to the B.Tech program at KMIT are made along with other engineering colleges in the state through a common entrance test (EAMCET) conducted by the Govt. of Telangana State. 70% of the seats are allotted based on the merit in EAMCET, while 30% of the seats are earmarked for Management/NRI candidates.

The admission process for the B.Tech program at KMIT involves appearing for the common entrance test (EAMCET) conducted by the Govt. of Telangana State. Seats are allocated based on the merit in EAMCET, with a certain percentage reserved for Management/NRI candidates.

Candidates seeking admission to the B.Tech program at KMIT need to appear for the common entrance test (EAMCET) conducted by the Govt. of Telangana State. Admissions are based on the merit in EAMCET, and a specific percentage of seats are reserved for Management/NRI candidates.

patterns: How can diploma holders get admission to the B.Tech program at KMIT?
Tell me about admission for diploma holders at KMIT
Diploma holders admission to B.Tech at KMIT
Admission process for diploma holders at KMIT
responses: Diploma holders are admitted to the second year of the B.Tech program at KMIT to the extent of 10% of intake based on the merit in the ECET, under the lateral entry scheme.

Admission for diploma holders to the B.Tech program at KMIT is conducted through the lateral entry scheme, where they are admitted directly to the second year based on the merit in the ECET. This scheme allows diploma holders to pursue their B.Tech degree.

At KMIT, diploma holders can secure admission to the second year of the B.Tech program through the lateral entry scheme. This scheme reserves 10% of the total intake for diploma holders, and admission is based on the merit in the ECET.

patterns: What is the BIRAC project about?
Tell me about the BIRAC project at KMIT.
Can you provide details about the BIRAC project?
responses: The BIRAC project at KMIT involves developing an AI-powered Clinical Translational Research CAD (Computer Aided Disease Detection & Diagnostics System) for various cancers.
KMIT's BIRAC project focuses on creating an end-to-end clinical diagnostics workflow, initially for Breast Cancer detection.
In the BIRAC project, KMIT is developing an AI-driven system for disease detection and diagnostics, with a special emphasis on Breast Cancer.

patterns: What is the Telescope platform by KMIT?
Tell me more about the Telescope platform launched by KMIT.
Can you explain how the Telescope platform works?
responses: Telescope is a digital platform launched by KMIT in 2016 for scheduling activities and virtual classrooms for undergraduate students of all streams.
The Telescope platform allows students to access scheduled activities and attend virtual classes through Adobe Connect.
With the Telescope platform, KMIT students can conveniently schedule and participate in virtual classrooms using Adobe Connect.

patterns: What is Tessellator at KMIT?

responses: Tessellator is KMIT's customized learning management system, based on MOODLE, offering modules for quizzes and programming assignments.
At KMIT, Tessellator serves as the primary learning management system, providing modules for quizzes and programming assignments.
KMIT's Tessellator learning management system, based on MOODLE, offers features like quizzes and programming assignments to enhance student learning.

Consultancy projects like CrimeFreeBharat are integral to KMIT's efforts to contribute expertise in areas such as cyber security and forensic science.

Google Summer of Code (GSoC) provides students with a paid internship to work on programming projects with open-source organizations.

The KMIT Central Library aims to provide access to a broad range of learning resources and information services to students and faculty, fostering intellectual growth and creativity.

The goals of the KMIT Central Library include developing collections, facilitating access to information resources, teaching effective use of these resources, and offering research assistance to promote intellectual growth and creativity.

Role of the Student Council?
How to get involved in the Student Council?
responses: The Student Council at KMIT plays an integral role in the student community, providing a representative structure for students to debate issues and undertake initiatives for the college and wider community.

patterns: What is Aakarshan club?
Tell me about Kaivalya club.
How to join Mudra dance club?
responses: Aakarshan is a cultural club promoting cultural activities and events. Kaivalya focuses on spiritual and philosophical discussions, while Mudra is a dance club promoting dance-related activities.

patterns: How can I contact the Autonomous Exam Branch?
What is the email ID for Placements at KMIT?
Contact details for Non-Autonomous (JNTUH-Exams) branch?
responses: You can reach the Autonomous Exam Branch at +91-9391614325 or autonomousams@gmail.com. For Placements, email exams@kmit.in. For Non-Autonomous (JNTUH-Exams), call 040-23261407.

patterns: Tell me about the placement statistics for 2023-2024 batch.
Average salary and highest salary in placements?
How many students got offers above 20 lakhs per annum?
responses: For the 2023-2024 batch, KMIT recorded a high number of placements with an average salary of 9.69 LPA. Several students received offers above 20 lakhs per annum.

patterns: Tell me about Keshav Memorial Institute of Technology (KMIT).
Where is the KMIT campus located?
Affiliations and approvals for KMIT?
responses: Keshav Memorial Institute of Technology (KMIT) is one of the premier engineering colleges in Telangana. It is located in Narayanaguda, Hyderabad, and is affiliated with JNTU, approved by AICTE, and recognized by the Govt. of Telangana.
